item.title: Siri add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:Dâ€™Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Siri add a quote by Jane Nelsen
item.description: "Where did we ever get the crazy idea that in order to make children do better, first we have to make them feel worse? Think of the last time you felt humiliated or treated unfairly. Did you feel like cooperating or doing better?" -- Jane Nelsen

item.title: Siri add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Siri add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Siri add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Siri add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Siri add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Siri add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Siri add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Siri add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Siri add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised or a little mistaken." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Siri add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Siri add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Real solemn history, I cannot be interested in.... The quarrels of popes and kings, with wars and pestilences in every page; the men all so good for nothing, and hardly any women at all." -- Jane Austen
